attributes.action: High risk and vulnerable parents, allowed to keep their children at home Covid19
attributes.additional_details: We face the risk that if we decide for health reasons to not send our children to school we could receive a fine and if we are not working due to shielding we face the financial burden when all we are trying to do is keep ourselves and our children safe.
attributes.background: I would like the government or Parliament to take into account that for us parents who are advised to shield, we have to make the very hard decision to send our children to school knowing that we will be at risk and that our children will be at risk.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that primary schools, secondary schools and colleges across England must move to remote provision from 5 January 2021, except for vulnerable children and the children of key workers.

You can read the Prime Minister's announcement of new Covid-19 restrictions, including school closures, here: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/prime-ministers-address-to-the-nation-4-january-2021

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

Enable online learning for children who live with those who are vulnerable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556586

Scrap fines for families with vulnerable members that keep children from school: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549629
